attributes.description:
Buses will replace train service between Kenmore and Reservoir from the start until the end of service on weekends from October 27 to December 16. This diversion will allow maintenance crews to upgrade and replace track and signals along the D Branch.

Shuttle buses will run on the following weekends:
October 27-28
November 3-4
November 10-11
November 17-18
November 24-25
December 1-2
December 8-9
December 15-16

All shuttle bus stops are accessible to persons with disabilities. Please allow additional time for your commute.

Please note, there will be NO shuttle bus service to Beaconsfield Station. Customers should use Reservoir (9 minute walk) or Dean Road on the C Branch (2 minute walk).

Affected stops:
Kenmore
Fenway
Longwood
Brookline Village
Brookline Hills
Beaconsfield
Reservoir

attributes.description:
We are working with our vendor to solve GPS tracking on D branch trains in the Newton area. We have deactivated countdown clocks at some D branch stations so that we are not providing incorrect predictions.

Thank you for your patience as we work to resolve this issue.
attributes.header: Green Line D branch notice: We are experiencing an issue with GPS tracking on D branch trains in the Newton area.
attributes.short_header: Green Line D branch notice: We are experiencing an issue with GPS tracking on D branch trains in the Newton area.

attributes.description:
If exiting at Central Square, continue to Kendall Station and utilize free shuttle bus service to Central Square.  The shuttle pick-up location is on Main St. near the station entrance for the Alewife platform.  Please see station personnel or utilize a station call box to request the shuttle.

If boarding at Central Square, utilize free shuttle bus for service to Kendall Station.  The shuttle pick-up location is on Massachusetts Ave. near Elevator 861.  Please see station personnel or utilize the station call box at street-level to request the shuttle.  As an alternative, cross the street and take Elevator 860 to the Alewife-bound platform. Take the Red Line to Harvard Square and switch to an Ashmont-/Braintree-bound train.

attributes.description:
Inbound passengers will board a free bus shuttle that will make all stops on the Lowell Line except North Station. The bus will run to Wellington Station on the Orange Line for continued service into Boston. There will be no direct connection to North Station. 

Passengers will need to pay the subway fare at Wellington Station. 

Bus shuttles will depart Wellington at the time the train is regularly scheduled to depart North Station. Outbound passengers will need to allow additional travel time to Wellington Station to connect with the free bus shuttles.
attributes.header: On weekends, July 7 -  December 2018, Lowell Line service in both directions will be replaced with a free bus shuttle connecting passengers to Wellington Station on the Orange Line due to Positive Train Control (PTC) testing.
attributes.short_header: Weekends, July 7 - Dec. 2018, Lowell Line replaced by free bus shuttles to/from Wellington Stn on the Orange Line. Visit mbta.com/lowell

attributes.description:
Customers looking to exit the Red Line at Andrew should exit at Broadway and utilize a station call box or see station personnel to request shuttle bus service to Andrew. Shuttle bus pick-up is located on the Dorchester Avenue side of Broadway Station. Customers looking to board at Andrew should utilize shuttle bus service to Broadway to make Red Line connections. 

The elevators are being taken out of service to facilitate a full replacement of the elevator lifts, hydraulics, and electrical systems.
attributes.header: Andrew Elevator 872 (Unpaid lobby to street), Elevator 879 (Ashmont/Braintree platform to paid lobby), and Elevator 880 (Alewife platform to paid lobby) are out of service through spring 2019 while they are being replaced.

attributes.description:
During MassDOT's construction on the Tobin Bridge and North Washington Street, the Commuter Rail will accept Charlie Cards between Chelsea and North Station (on the Newburyport/Rockport Line) through summer 2019. The trip into North Station is approximately 12 minutes, and trains leave roughly every 30 minutes during peak hours. Schedule for Newburyport/Rockport is available here: https://www.mbta.com/schedules/CR-Newburyport/timetable 

Customers should show their Charlie Card to the conductor or fare inspector when asked. Charlie Cards are available at Haymarket and other major stations between 7 AM and 7 PM (2:30 PM on Sundays at Haymarket). Please see a station agent for assistance or visit https://www.mbta.com/fares/charliecard for details.
attributes.header: Due to construction on the Tobin Bridge & N. Washington St, we anticipate delays to local bus Routes 111, 112, 114, 116, & 117. The Commuter Rail will accept Charlie Cards between Chelsea & North Station to provide alternate service options for customers.
attributes.short_header: Due to construction, we expect delays to bus Rts 111, 112, 114, 116, & 117. Commuter Rail will accept Charlie Cards btwn Chelsea & N Station

attributes.description:
Service to Ames Street stops is scheduled to begin in mid fall.

attributes.description:
If exiting, take the Orange Line to Community College and return to North Station on a Forest Hills-bound train and exit using North Station Elevator 910. If boarding, use North Station Elevator 910 to board a Forest Hills-bound train. At Haymarket, switch to an Oak Grove-bound train. 
Alternatively, customers may exit at Haymarket, cross New Chardon Street, and travel three-tenths of a mile down Canal Street to North Station at Causeway Street.
attributes.header: North Station Elevator 911 (Oak Grove platform to paid lobby) unavailable due to maintenance

attributes.description:
Access to the Kendall/MIT Station will remain open and accessible on the Main Street side of the station throughout this construction.
 
The pedestrian plaza between Carleton Street and Main Street in Kendall Square will be closed due to the construction of an underground garage. 
 
Customers are encouraged to utilize alternative paths to/from the station using the paths on Ames Street, Dock Street, or Wadsworth Street.

Affected routes:
Red Line
attributes.header: The pedestrian walkway near Kendall/MIT Station (inbound) is closed until further notice due to MIT construction.

attributes.description:
Customers are advised that the pedestrian route for customers transferring from the Green and Orange Line exits at Causeway and Beverly St into North Station Commuter Rail will be moved slightly to accommodate ongoing construction work. 

After crossing Causeway St, pedestrians will use a protected walkway along the east side of Legends Way, directly abutting Portal Park. The walkway will include a barrier and kick-plate for blind and low vision passengers.

As an alternative, customers may consider utilizing the west exit from North Station Commuter Rail due to congestion.
attributes.header: Access to the east entrance of North Station is available through a covered walkway. Legends Way is closed to pedestrian access.
attributes.short_header: Access to the east entrance of North Station is available through a covered walkway. Legends Way is closed to pedestrian access.

attributes.description:
Due to construction of the new Forest Hills upper busway canopy, Route 39 buses will pick up and drop off on Washington Street directly adjacent to the upper busway through Fall 2018. Customers exiting Forest Hill Station to the upper busway will turn right once outside the doors to the sidewalk for service.

Affected stops:
Forest Hills (inbound)
Forest Hills (outbound)

Affected routes:
39
attributes.header: As of June 25, the Route 39 bus stop at Forest Hills Upper Busway has moved to Washington Street due to construction of the busway canopy.

attributes.description:
Buses replace train service between Oak Grove and Wellington in both directions from the start to the end of service on Saturday, November 3, and Sunday, November 4. This will allow maintenance crews to reinforce Orange Line and Commuter Rail bridges in Malden.

All shuttle bus stops are accessible to persons with disabilities. Please allow additional time for your commute. Regular train service with resume with the start of service on Monday, November 5.

Affected stops:
Oak Grove
Malden Center
Wellington
attributes.header: Shuttle buses will replace Orange Line service between Oak Grove and Wellington on the weekend of November 3-4 due to bridge work.
attributes.short_header: Shuttle buses will replace Orange Line service between Oak Grove and Wellington on the weekend of November 3-4 due to bridge work.

attributes.description:
Please allow additional travel time as buses will depart earlier than scheduled train departure times.  Amended schedules are available on the Fitchburg Line schedule page as well as on station posters. 

During this time, crews will replace approximately 30,000 rail ties.  

Affected trips:
403 (7:43 am from North Station)
405 (8:45 am from North Station)
412 (9:37 am from Wachusett)
407 (10:00 am from North Station)
414 (10:50 am from Wachusett)

416 (12:05 pm from Wachusett)
411 (12:45 pm from North Station)
418 (1:30 pm from Wachusett)
413 (1:55 pm from North Station)
420 (2:50 pm from Wachusett)
422 (4:05 pm from Wachusett)
attributes.header: On weekdays, 10/15-11/30, bus shuttles will replace mid-day Fitchburg Line train service between Littleton and Wachusett stations due to rail tie replacement.
attributes.short_header: On weekdays, 10/15-11/30, shuttles will replace mid-day Fitch Ln trains between Littleton & Wachusett.

attributes.description:
From September 28 - October 28, the Newport Ave Parking Lot will be closed on weekends, including Columbus Day. Vehicles left overnight will be relocated to the Hancock Street Parking Lot.

Weekday parking will not be affected and all spaces will be available for parking on the following Monday at the start of service. The parking lot will undergo work to repave, improve accessibility, and add parking spaces.
attributes.header: North Quincy Newport Avenue Parking Lot will be closed on weekends from 8:00 PM on Fridays through end of service on Sundays beginning September 28 due to construction.
attributes.short_header: N Quincy Newport Ave Parking Lot will be closed on weekends from 8pm on Fridays through end of service on Sundays beginning Sep 28

attributes.description:
Customers are encouraged to use the Station Landing Garage (74 Presidents Landing, Medford, MA), connected to Wellington Station. MBTA customers should park on Levels 6 - 8 and use the pedestrian bridge on Level 3 to access Wellington Station for Orange Line and bus connections. Garage cost is $5/day or $95/month.

During the closure, Pick-Ups & Drop-Offs will be relocated to a dedicated right-hand lane on Maffa Way. 

Thank you for your patience and cooperation. Questions and concerns contact: sullivanquestions@mbta.com
attributes.header: Sullivan Square Parking Lot will be closed from Tuesday, October 9, through Friday, November 16, due to construction.
attributes.short_header: Sullivan Square Parking Lot will be closed from Tuesday, October 9, through Friday, November 16, due to construction.

attributes.description:
Buses replace train service between Alewife and Harvard in both directions on weekends from the start to the end of service. The diversion will allow maintenance crews to perform necessary rail, tie, and overall track work.

Shuttling will occur on the following weekends:
November 10-11
November 17-18
November 24-25
December 1-2

All shuttle bus stops are accessible to persons with disabilities. Please allow additional time for your commute. Regular train service will resume at the start of service on the following Mondays.

Affected stops:
Alewife
Davis
Porter
Harvard
attributes.header: Shuttle buses will replace Red Line service between Alewife and Harvard on weekends from November 10 to December 2 due to track work.
attributes.short_header: Shuttle buses will replace Red Line service between Alewife and Harvard on weekends from November 10 to December 2 due to track work.

attributes.description:
Customers looking to exit the Red Line at Quincy Center should exit at Quincy Adams and utilize shuttle van service to Quincy Center. Customers looking to board at Quincy Center should utilize shuttle van service to Quincy Adams to make Red Line connections. Please see station personnel or utilize a station call box to request assistance. 

The elevator is being taken out of service to be repaired as part of the Wollaston Station Improvements & Quincy Center Garage Demolition Project.

Click here for more information: www.mbta.com/wollaston
attributes.header: Quincy Center Elevator 810 (Red Line platform to lobby) is out of service through spring 2019.
attributes.short_header: Quincy Center Elevator 810 (Red Line platform to lobby) is out of service through spring 2019.

attributes.description: Please use adjacent State Street Elevator 967.
